required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized Clinical Trial Comparing Transradial Catheterization With or Without Spasmolytic Drugs
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Clinical Trial Comparing Transradial Catheterization With or Without Spasmolytic Drugs.

lead_sponsor.agency: Instituto de Cardiologia de Santa Catarina

clinical_study.source: Instituto de Cardiologia de Santa Catarina

brief_summary.textblock:
Single-center study, randomized, double-blind, placebo controlled, with patients undergoing diagnostic or therapeutic catheterization via the transradial approach. Patients will be randomized into two groups: one group will receive the vasodilator nitroglycerin during the procedure (intervention group), and a second group will receive saline 0.9% in the same volume and time during the procedure (control group).
Will be evaluated: incidence of spasms of the radial artery, ability to perform the procedure without the need to change the access site, pain presented by the patient, time and total radiation of the procedure.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Pain Assessment Using Visual Analogue Scale
primary_outcome.description: the patients' feeling of pain in the forearm, and it was measured using a visual analogue scale (VAS), applied at the end of the procedure by an interventional nurse. The VAS consists of a single line measuring 100 mm, anchored by verbal descriptors, saying 'no pain' and 'worst possible pain'. Higher values mean a worse pain.

secondary_outcome.description: Procedure duration, from artery catheterization up to removal of sheath.
Total radiation required to complete the procedure.

arm_group.description: Placebo (saline solution 10 ml) in radial artery after sheath insertion
Nitroglycerin (200 micrograms) + saline solution 10 ml in radial artery after sheath insertion

intervention.description: Nitroglycerin (200 micrograms) + saline solution 10 ml in radial artery after sheath insertion
Placebo (saline solution 10 ml) in radial artery after sheath insertion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Indication for cardiac catheterization
- Suitable candidates for transradial approach
Exclusion Criteria:
- AMI
- Intubated patients
- Complications during procedure (cardiac arrest, pulmonary edema, cardiogenic shock, stroke)
- Prior inclusion in this trial

overall_official.affiliation: Instituto de Cardiologia de Santa Catarina

facility.name: Instituto de Cardiologia de Santa Catarina

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Instituto de Cardiologia de Santa Catarina

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Study was designed as a single-centre, prospective, randomised, placebo-controlled, double-blind trial with an all-comers design. All eligible patients were aged 18 years or over with a clinical indication for coronary angiography (ad hoc angioplasty was allowed) or percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Procedures were conducted in a single, high-volume center. All, but one, operators had high experience in radial access.
